definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: She kept hoping he would change his feelings.
sentences.chinese: 她一直希望他能回心轉意。

sentences.english: We had hoped that she would change her mind.
sentences.chinese: 我們真希望她回心轉意。

sentences.english: Under ours work, Sampson already changed an attitude at present.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的工作下，桑普森目前已經回心轉意。

sentences.english: I hope you change mind carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我的小心翼翼，希望你的回心轉意。

sentences.english: I hope his girlfriend to chane their mind.
Or maybe the fact that he had returned would speak for itself.
sentences.chinese: 或許他回心轉意的事實本身就已經把一切都說明了。

sentences.english: I dare say you'll think better of it in an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我敢說你不出一小時就會回心轉意。

sentences.english: I think he'll come round eventually.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他最終會回心轉意的。

sentences.english: She always spoke 1001 nights, finally made the king back from the brink.
sentences.chinese: 她一直講了一千零一夜，終於使國王回心轉意。

sentences.english: I turned my face because I was afraid I would change my mind at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 我轉過臉去，因爲我擔心我會在最後一刻回心轉意。

sentences.english: Turn from thy fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against thy people.
sentences.chinese: 所以，求你息怒，回心轉意，不要降禍給你的子民吧。

sentences.english: He will bring many of Israel's people back to the Lord their God.
sentences.chinese: 他要勸導許多以色列人回心轉意，歸順他們的上帝。

sentences.english: If you find your heart, give us a call.
sentences.chinese: 當你回心轉意的時候，給我們打個電話。

definition: to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
